metadata.title: CVE-2014-125023 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability was found in FFmpeg 2.0. It has been declared asproblematic. Affected by this vulnerability is the functiontruemotion1_decode_header of the component Truemotion1 Handler. Themanipulation leads to memory corruption. The attack can be launchedremotely. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue.

criterions.comment: ffmpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
